comment.author: 42482532@N05
comment._content:
1865 Atlantics of Brooklyn 

(Left to Right)
Frank Norton, Sid Smith, Dickey Pierce, Joe Start, Pete O'Brien (Manager), Charles Smith, John Chapman, Fred Crane, John Galvin, Tom Platt

In 1864 the team finished with 20 wins and no losses.
In 1865 they finished 18 and 0.

Powerhouse!

comment._content: The civil war lasted until April 1965.  I guess these boys sat out the war playing baseball.  Maybe they didn't have any real comptition.  Things haven't changed much.

comment.author: 27608206@N08
comment._content: Does the Library of Congress intend to save comments posted in the comments section on various items posted in this photostream? For instance will the comments be archived as being historically relevent? When somebody posts a comment to one of these photos doesn't that comment also become a part of the historical record and shouldn't the comments be saved for future posterity? Also, concerning the other various U.S. government entities who are also utilizing Flickr, will those comments on say the Official Whitehouse Photostream be filed away for historical documentation? What system does the Library of Congress have in place to save and document various discussions on a U.S. Government sponsored disccussion board?

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: The Library of Congress currently downloads a copy of all comments made to our Flickr account. We are not aware of the practice of other agencies.
